answers.author: Mark Levin
answers.text:
On our bi-annual citizen survey (telephone) we ask if citizens can access the internet from home (79%), have they visited the city's website at least once (63%), if so how frequently and how do they rate it. We also ask how frequently do they read the city's newsletter (56% read them all and another 32% read most) and how do they rate it.

author: Karen Walz-Fuentes
text: How are you defining and measuring your ability connect to residents in your community?  What indexes do you use?  Are you utilizing a resident survey?  Do you utilize metrics from on-line civic engagement tools? Are you using any census data, and if so, which data points? Do you measure volunteerism and charitable giving?  All examples and suggestions are welcome.
title: Measuring connectedness in your community
